gurmukhi: < siqgur pRswid ]
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: 1 gur cylw
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: pIr murIdI gwKVI ko ivrlw jwxY
transliteration: Peer Mureedee Gaakharhee Ko Viralaa Jaanai.
translation: Discipleship of the Guru is such a difficult task that only a rare one can understand it.

gurmukhi: pIrw pIru vKwxIAY gur gurw vKwxY
transliteration: Peeraa Peeru Vakhaaneeai Guru Guraan Vakhaanai.
translation: He, who knows it, becomes guide of spiritual guides and chief Guru of Gurus.

gurmukhi: guru cylw cylw gurU kir coj ivfwxY
transliteration: Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Guroo Kari Choj Vidaanai.
translation: In this stage the wonderful feat of becoming Guru by the disciple and vice-versa is enacted.

gurmukhi: so guru soeI isK hY joqI joiq smwxY
transliteration: So Guru Soee Sikhu Hai Jotee Joti Samaanai.
translation: Externally the Sikh and Guru remain as they were, but internally, the light of the one permeates the other.

gurmukhi: ieku gurU ieku isKu hY guru sbid is\\wxY
transliteration: Iku Guru Iku Sikhu Hai Guru Sabadi Siaanai.
translation: Becoming the Sikh of the One Guru, the disciple understands the word of the Guru.

gurmukhi: imhr muhbiq mylu kir Bau Bwau su BwxY ]1]
transliteration: Mihar Muhabati Maylu Kari Bhau Bhaau Su Bhaanai ?1?
translation: Grace of the Guru and love of the disciple meeting together in the divine order join each other in the form of the love of the Guru and fear in the mind of the disciple to create a balanced and handsome personality.

gurmukhi: 2 pIr QoN pIr hoxw
translation: Making of the Guru by the Guru

gurmukhi: gur isKhu gur isKu hY pIr pIrhu koeI
transliteration: Gur Sikhahu Gur Sikhu Hai Peer Peerahu Koee.
translation: By the teachings of the Guru many become disciples of the Guru, but some rare one becomes the Guru like that Guru.

gurmukhi: sbid suriq cylw gurU prmysru soeI
transliteration: Sabadi Surati Chaylaa Guroo Paramaysaru Soee.
translation: Only the practitioner of the word and consciousness can attain the status of Guru-God.

gurmukhi: drsin idsit iDAwnu Dir gur mUriq hoeI
transliteration: Darasani Disati Dhiaan Dhari Gur Moorati Hoee.
translation: Such a disciple concentrating on the philosophy of the Guru (and making it a part of daily conduct) himself becomes a likeness of Guru.

gurmukhi: sbd suriq kr kIrqnu siqsMig ivloeI
transliteration: Sabad Surati Kari Keeratanu Satisangi Viloee.
translation: Making his consciousness attentive to Word through recitation of Naam, he merges in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: vwihgurU gurmMqR hY jip haumY KoeI
transliteration: Vaahiguroo Guramantr Hai Japi Haoumai Khoee.
translation: His Guru-manta is Vahiguru, whose recitation erases egotism.

gurmukhi: Awpu gvwey Awip hY gux guxI proeI ]2]
transliteration: Aapu Gavaaay Aapi Hai Goun Gounee Paroee ?2?
translation: Losing egotism and merging into the qualities of the supreme Lord, he himself becomes full of qualities.

gurmukhi: 3 sMjogI Awid vrnx
translation: Being fortunate

gurmukhi: drsn idsit sMjog hY BY Bwie sMjogI
transliteration: Darasan Disati Sanjogu Hai Bhai Bhaai Sanjogee.
translation: He, who has the opportunity of the glimpse of the Guru, is a fortunate person well aware of the virtues of love and awe.

gurmukhi: sbd suriq bYrwgu hY suK shj ArogI
transliteration: Sabad Surati Bairaagu Hai Soukh Sahaj Arogee.
translation: Adopting the renunciation in the form of Word consciousness, he residing in equipoise is free from all maladies.

gurmukhi: mn bc krm n Brm hY jogIsru jogI
transliteration: Man Bach Karam N Bharamu Hai Jogeesaru Jogee.
translation: His mind, speech and actions are not engrossed in delusions and he is king of the yogis.

gurmukhi: iprm ipAwlw pIvxw AMmiRq rs BogI
transliteration: Piram Piaalaa Peevanaa Anmrit Ras Bhogee.
translation: He is the quaffer of the cup of love and remains merged in the delight of nectar.

gurmukhi: igAwnu iDAwnu ismrxu imlY pI AipE AsogI ]3]
transliteration: Giaanu Dhiaanu Simaranu Milai Pee Apiao Asogee ?3?
translation: Drinking the elixir of knowledge, meditation and remembrance of the Lord, he has gone beyond all sorrows and sufferings.

gurmukhi: 4 iprm rs
translation: Elixir of love

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm rsu ikau AwiK vKwxY
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Kiu Aakhi Vakhaanai.
translation: Quaffing the elixir of love giving fruits of delight, how could a gurmukh explain that ineffable joy?

gurmukhi: suix suix AwKxu AwKxw Ehu swau n jwxY
transliteration: Souni Souni Aakhanu Aakhanaa Aohu Saau N Jaanai.
translation: Much is said and listened to but the people remain ignorant of its real taste.

gurmukhi: bHmw ibsnu mhysu imil kiQ vyd purwxY
transliteration: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Mili Kadi Vayd Puraanai.
translation: In the Vedas and Puranas, Brahma, Visnu and Mahesa have told enough about the delight of love.

gurmukhi: cwir kqybw AwKIAin dIn muslmwxY
transliteration: Chaari Kataybaan Aakheeani Deen Mousalamaanai.
translation: One can see the four scriptures of semitic religion in this context.

gurmukhi: syKnwgu ismrxu krY swNgIq suhwxY
transliteration: Saykhanaagu Simaranu Karai Saangeet Suhaanai.
translation: Sesanag also remembers it and all musical measures also are busy in adorning it.

gurmukhi: Anhd nwd AsMK suix hoey hYrwxY
transliteration: Anahad Naad Asankh Souni Hoay Hairaanai.
translation: One becomes full of wonder after listening to the myriads of unstruck melodies,

gurmukhi: AkQ kQw kir nyq nyq pIlwey BwxY ]4]
transliteration: Akad Kadaa Kari Nayti Nayti Peelaaay Bhaanai ?4?
translation: But the tale of that elixir, love, is ineffable which one fortunately drinks in the will of the Lord.

gurmukhi: 5 qQw iprm rs
translation: Elixir of love

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm rsu iCA rs hYrwxw
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Chhia Ras Hairaanaa.
translation: Even the six tastes (satras) are full of wonder before the gurmukh’s delightful fruit in the form of elixir of love.

gurmukhi: CqIh AMmiRq qrsdy ivsmwd ivfwxw
transliteration: Chhateeh Anmrit Tarasaday Visamaad Vidaanaa.
translation: Thirty six types of repasts, getting aweful before its grandeur, crave for being equal to it.

gurmukhi: inJr Dwr hjwr hoie BY cikq Bulwxw
transliteration: Nijhar Dhaar Hajaar Hoi Bhai Chakit Bhulaanaa.
translation: Even myriads of currents of delight flowing through the tenth gate become full of wonder and fear before it.

gurmukhi: ieVw ipMgulw suKmnw sohM n smwxw
transliteration: Irhaa Pingulaa Soukhamanaa Sohan N Samaanaa.
translation: The taste of the recitation of Soham in the base of ira, pingala and susumna nerves is not equal to the taste of the elixir of love.

gurmukhi: vIh iekIh cVwau ciV prcw prvwxw
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Charhaau Charhi Parachaa Paravaanaa.
translation: Going beyond the animate and inanimate i.e. the whole world, the consciousness is merged in the Lord.

gurmukhi: pIqY boil n hMGeI AwKwx vKwxw ]5]
transliteration: Peetai Boli N Hanghaee Aakhaan Vakhaanaa ?5?
translation: Then the situation turns out to be such that as one cannot speak while drinking, the talk of drinking of the elixir of love becomes ineffable.

gurmukhi: 6 Almsq vrxn
translation: Description of the delight

gurmukhi: glI swdu n AwveI ijcru muhu KwlI
transliteration: Galee Saadu N Aavaee Jicharu Muhu Khaalee.
translation: So long as a tasty object enters not the mouth, mere talking about taste cannot bring any joy.

gurmukhi: muhu BirAY ikauN bolIAY rs jIB rswlI
transliteration: Muhu Bhariai Kioun Boleeai Ras Jeebh Rasaalee.
translation: When holding the object the mouth is full of taste and tongue full of delight, how could one speak?

gurmukhi: sbdu suriq ismrx aulMiG nih ndir inhwlI
transliteration: Sabadu Surati Simaran Ulaghi Nahi Nadari Nihaalee.
translation: Going past the stage of recitation those whose consciousness gets merged in the Word, do not see anything except the Lord.

gurmukhi: pMQu kupMQu n suJeI Almsq iKAwlI
transliteration: Pandu Koupandu N Sujhaee Alamasat Khiaalee.
translation: For the people drenched in love, good or bad ways have not meaning.

gurmukhi: fgmg cwl suFwl hY gurmiq inrwlI
transliteration: Dagamag Chaal Suddhaal Hai Guramati Niraalee.
translation: Wobbling gait of the person full of love for the wisdom of the Guru (gurmat) looks distinctly beautiful.

gurmukhi: ciVAw cMdu n lukeI Fik joiq kunwlI ]6]
transliteration: Charhiaa Chandu N Loukaee Ddhaki Joti Kounaalee ?6?
translation: Now the moon emerged in the sky of heart cannot remain hidden in spite of efforts to cover its light with flour kneading basin.

gurmukhi: 7 iprm rs
translation: Elixir of love

gurmukhi: lK lK bwvn cMdnw lK Agr imlMdy
transliteration: Lakh Lakh Baavan Chandanaa Lakh Agar Miladay.
translation: Myriads of sandals and fragrant sticks may be mixed;

gurmukhi: lK kpUr kQUrIAw AMbr mihkMdy
transliteration: Lakh Kapoor Kadooreeaa Anbar Mahikanday.
translation: With myriads camphor’s and musk’s the sky may be made full of fragrance;

gurmukhi: lK lK gauVy myd imil kysr cmkMdy
transliteration: Lakh Lakh Gaurhay Mayd Mili Kaysar Chamakanday.
translation: If myriads of saffron are mixed with yellow pigment of cow;

gurmukhi: sB sugMD rlwiekY Argjw krMdy
transliteration: Sabh Sougandh Ralaai Kai Aragajaa Karanday.
translation: And of all these fragrances an incense stick is prepared;

gurmukhi: lK Argjy Pulyl Pul PulvwVI sMdy
transliteration: Lakh Aragajay Phulayl Phul Phulavaarhee Sanday.
translation: Then myriads of such sticks may be mixed with the fragrance of flowers and scents,

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl iprmrsu vwsU n lhMdy ]7]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Piram Rasu Vaasoo N Lahanday ?7?
translation: Even then all these cannot withstand the fragrance of the elixir of love of the gurmukh.

gurmukhi: 8 iprm rs
translation: Joy of love

gurmukhi: rUp srUp AnUp lK ieMdR purI vsMdy
transliteration: Roop Saroop Anoop Lakh Indr Puree Vasanday.
translation: Millions of handsome people reside in the Indrapuri;

gurmukhi: rMg ibrMg surMg lK bYkuMT rhMdy
transliteration: Rang Birang Surang Lakh Baikountd Rahanday.
translation: Millions of beautiful people reside in the heaven;

gurmukhi: lK jobn sIgwr lK lK vys krMdy
transliteration: Lakh Joban Seegaar Lakh Lakh Vays Karanday.
translation: Millions of young persons wear many types of attires;

gurmukhi: lK dIvy lK qwirAwN joiq sUrj cMdy
transliteration: Lakh Deevay Lakh Taariaan Joti Sooraj Chanday.
translation: Millions are the lights of millions of lamps, stars, suns and moons;

gurmukhi: rqn jvwhr lKmxI jgmg thkMdy
transliteration: Ratan Javaahar Lakh Manee Jagamag Tahakanday.
translation: Millions of lights of jewels and rubies also glitter.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm rs joqI n pujMdy ]8]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Ras Jotee N Pujanday ?8?
translation: But all these lights cannot reach up to the light of the elixir of love i.e. all these lights are pale before it.

gurmukhi: 9 iprm rs
translation: Supereme delight

gurmukhi: cwir pdwrQ iriD isiD iniD lK kroVI
transliteration: Chaari Padaarad Ridhi Sidhi Nisi Lakh Karorhee.
translation: In all of the four ideals of life, riddhis, siddhis and myriads of treasures;

gurmukhi: lK pwrs lK pwrjwq lK lKmI joVI
transliteration: Lakh Paaras Lakh Paarijaat Lakh Lakhamee Jorhee.
translation: Philosopher’s stones, wish fulfilling trees and many varieties of wealth are collected;

gurmukhi: lK icMqwmix kwmDyn cqurMg cmoVI
transliteration: Lakh Chintaamani Kaamadhaynu Chaturang Chamorhee.
translation: Myriads of fabulous gems supposed to yield anything desired and wish fulfilling cows are also added to all this;

gurmukhi: mwxk moqI hIirAw inrmol mhoVI
transliteration: Maanak Motee Heeriaa Niramol Marorhee.
translation: Again invaluable jewels, pearls and diamonds are kept with all this;

gurmukhi: lK kivlws sumyru lK lK rwj bhoVI
transliteration: Lakh Kavilaas Soumayru Lakh Lakh Raaj Bahorhee.
translation: Myriads of kailas and Sumer mountains are also gathered together;

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm rs mulu Amulu suQoVI ]9]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Mulu Amulu Sudorhee ?9?
translation: Even then they all have no standing at all before the invaluable elixir of love of the gurmukhs.

gurmukhi: 10 pRym ipAwly dI bUMd
translation: The drop of the cup of love

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl lK lK lK lhir qrMgw
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Lakh Lakh Lakh Lahir Tarangaa.
translation: The gurmukhs identify the wave of delightful fruit among the illusionary waves of the world ocean.

gurmukhi: lK drIAwau smwau kir lK lhrI AMgw
transliteration: Lakh Dareeaau Samaau Kari Lakh Laharee Angaa.
translation: They bear upon their body millions of waves of worldly rivers.

gurmukhi: lK drIAwau smuMd ivic lK qIrQ gMgw
transliteration: Lakh Dareeaau Samound Vichi Lakh Teerad Gangaa.
translation: Myriads of rivers are there in the ocean and likewise many are pilgrimage centres on the Ganges.

gurmukhi: lK smuMd gVwV ivic bhu rMg ibrMgw
transliteration: Lakh Samound Garhaarh Vichi Bahu Rang Birangaa.
translation: In the oceans are millions of sea of varying forms and hues.

gurmukhi: lK gVwV qrMg ivic lK AJu ikxMgw
transliteration: Lakh Garhaarh Tarang Vichi Lakh Ajhu Kinangaa.
translation: Such oceans may be visualized in one drop of the tears of love.

gurmukhi: iprm ipAwlw pIvxw ko burw n cMgw ]10]
transliteration: Piram Piaalaa Peevanaa Ko Buraa N Changaa ?10?
translation: Nothing is good or bad for the man who quaffs from the cup of love.

gurmukhi: 11 byAMqqw
translation: The infinity

gurmukhi: iek kvwau pswau kir EAMkwr suxwieAw
transliteration: Ik Kavaau Pasaau Kari Aoankaaru Sounaaiaa.
translation: From one resonance the Oankar-Braham created the whole universe.

gurmukhi: EAMkwr Akwr lK bHmMf bxwieAw
transliteration: Aoankaari Akaar Lakh Brahamand Banaaiaa.
translation: The very Oankar assumed the form of millions of universes.

gurmukhi: pMj qq auqpiq lK qRY loA suhwieAw
transliteration: Panji Tatu Outapati Lakh Trai Loa Suhaaiaa.
translation: Five elements were created, myriads of productions were made and all the three worlds were adorned.

gurmukhi: jil Qil igir qrvr sPl drIAwv clwieAw
transliteration: Jalidali Giri Taravar Saphal Dareeaav Chalaaiaa.
translation: He created water, earth, mountains, trees and made the holy rivers flow.

gurmukhi: lK drIAwau smwau kir iql qul n qulwieAw
transliteration: Lakh Dareeaau Samaau Kari Til Tul N Tulaaiaa.
translation: He created great oceans that subsume in them myriads of rivers.

gurmukhi: kudriq iek AqolvI lyKw n ilKwieAw
transliteration: Kudarati Ik Atolavee Laykhaa N Likhaaiaa.
translation: A fraction of their grandeur cannot be explained. Only nature is infinite whose expanse cannot be counted.

gurmukhi: kudriq kIm n jwxIAY kwdru ikin pwieAw ]11]
transliteration: Kudarati Keem N Jaaneeai Kaadaru Kini Paaiaa ?11?
translation: When nature is unknowable how could its creator be known?

gurmukhi: 12 pRym pRXwly dI iek bUMd
translation: One drop of the cup of love

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu pRym rsu Aibgiq giq BweI
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Praym Rasu Abigati Gati Bhaaee.
translation: Ineffable is the taste of the joy of love, which is the pleasure fruit of the gurmukhs.

gurmukhi: pwrwvwru Apwru hY ko Awie n jweI
transliteration: Paaraavaaru Apaaru Hai Ko Aai N Jaaee.
translation: It’s this shore and the yonder one are beyond limits none can reach it.

gurmukhi: Awid AMiq prjMq nwih prmwid vfweI
transliteration: Aadi Anti Parajant Naahi Paramaadi Vadaaee.
translation: Its beginning and end are unfathomable and its grandeur is most eminent.

gurmukhi: hwQ n pwie AQwh dI Asgwh smweI
transliteration: Haad N Paai Adaah Dee Asagaah Samaaee.
translation: It is so much that many of the oceans immerse in it yet its depth remains unknown.

gurmukhi: iprm ipAwly bUMd iek ikin kImiq pweI
transliteration: Piram Piaalay Boond Ik Kini Keemati Paaee.
translation: Who could evaluate even one drop of such a cup of love.

gurmukhi: Agmhu Agm AgwiD boD gur AlKu lKweI ]12]
transliteration: Agamahu Agam Agaadhi Bodh Gur Alakhu Lakhaaee ?12?
translation: It is inaccessible and its knowledge is unfathomable, but the Guru can make one realise this imperceptible cup of love.

gurmukhi: 13 pRym rs dI iek inmK
translation: One moment of the joy of love

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm rsu iqlu AlKu AlyKY
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Tilu Alakhu Alaykhai.
translation: Even a fraction of pleasure fruit of gurmukhs in the form of joy of love is imperceptible and beyond all accounts.

gurmukhi: lK caurwsIh jUin ivic jIA jMq ivsyKY
transliteration: Lakh Chauraaseeh Jooni Vichi Jeea Jant Visaykhai.
translation: Many are the creatures in the eighty-four lacs of species.

gurmukhi: sBnw dI romwvlI bhu ibiD bhu ByKY
transliteration: Sabhanaa Dee Romaavalee Bahu Bidhi Bahu Bhaykhai.
translation: They all have variegated colour of their trichomes.

gurmukhi: roim roim lK lK isr muhu lK sryKY
transliteration: Romi Romi Lakh Lakh Sir Muhu Lakh Saraykhai.
translation: If to their single hair millions of heads and mouths were joined;

gurmukhi: lK lK muih muih jIBu kir suix bolY dyKY
transliteration: Lakh Lakh Muhi Muhi Jeebhu Kari Souni Bolai Daykhai.
translation: If such million of mouths could speak through their millions of tongues;

gurmukhi: sMK AsMK iekIh vIh smsr n inmyKY ]13]
transliteration: Sankh Asankh Ikeeh Veeh Samasari N Nimaykhai ?13?
translation: If myriad times more the world were created, even then it cannot equal the one moment (of the delight of love).

gurmukhi: 14 pRym rs ikkUM imldw hY
translation: How the joy of love is attained     ?

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl iprm rs huie guru isK mylw
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Piram Rasu Hui Guru Sikh Maylaa.
translation: After meeting the Guru i.e. after adopting the teachings of the Guru, the gurmukh receives the pleasure-fruit of the joy of love.

gurmukhi: sbd suriq prcwie kY inq nyh nvylw
transliteration: Sabad Surati Parachaai Kai Nit Nayhu Navaylaa.
translation: The Guru merges the consciousness of the disciple into the Word and creates ever-new love for the Lord in it.

gurmukhi: vIh iekIh cVwau ciV isK guru guru cylw
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Charhaau Charhi Sikh Guru Guru Chaylaa.
translation: Thus getting above the worldliness, the disciple becomes Guru and the Guru disciple.

gurmukhi: Aipau pIAY Ajru jrY gur syv suhylw
transliteration: Apiu Peeai Ajaru Jarai Gur Sayv Suhaylaa.
translation: Now he quaffs the unbearable drink of the juice of love and further bears the unbearable. But all this becomes possible only through the service of the Guru

gurmukhi: jIvidAw mir clxw hwir ijxY vhylw
transliteration: Jeevadiaa Mari Chalanaa Haari Jinai Vahaylaa.
translation: (To attain the delight of love) One has to put to death his ego and by becoming indifferent to the world has to conquer it.

gurmukhi: isl AwlUxI ctxI lK AMmiRq pylw ]14]
transliteration: Sil Aloonee Chatanee Lakh Anmrit Paylaa ?14?
translation: One who has licked this tasteless (unsalty) stone i.e. who has adopted the way of desireless devotion, he alone throws away myriads of delights equal to the immortalising elixirs.

gurmukhi: 15 ibrd dI lwj
translation: Living up to one's natural repute

gurmukhi: pwxI kwT n fobeI pwly dI ljY
transliteration: Paanee Kaatdu N Dobaee Paalay Dee Lajai.
translation: Water does not drown the wood because it lives up to its natural repute of nurturing the things (water rears up the vegetation).

gurmukhi: isir klvqR DrwiekY isir ciVAw BjY
transliteration: Siri Kalavatr Dharaai Kai Siri Charhiaa Bhajai.
translation: It bears the vessel on its head like a saw because the vessel shears the water and moves ahead.

gurmukhi: lohy jVIAY boihQw Bwir Bry n qjY
transliteration: Lohay Jarheeai Bohidaa Bhaari Bharay N Tajai.
translation: Of course, iron is studded into the wood but water bears the burden of it also.

gurmukhi: pytY AMdir Aig riK iqsu pVdw kjY
transliteration: Paytay Andari Agi Rakhi Tisu Parhadaa Kajai.
translation: Water knows that its enemy fire exists in wood but still it covers up this fact and does not drown it.

gurmukhi: AgrY fobY jwix kY inrmolk DjY
transliteration: Agarai Dobai Jaani Kai Niramolak Dhajai.
translation: The sandal wood is knowingly drowned so that it is proved to be the real sandal wood and its price may be fixed higher.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrig clxw Cif KbY sjY ]15]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Maaragi Chalanaa Chhadi Khabai Sajai ?15?
translation: The way of the gurmukhs is also the same; they without the caring for the loss and the profit go on moving further and further.

gurmukhi: 16 hIrw
translation: Diamond

gurmukhi: Kwix auKix kiF Awxdy inrmolk hIrw
transliteration: Khaani Oukhani Kaddhi Aanaday Niramolak Heeraa.
translation: By digging into the mine the diamond is brought out.

gurmukhi: jauhrIAw hiQ Awvdw auie gihr gMBIrw
transliteration: Jauhareeaa Hadi Aavadaa Ui Gahir Ganbheeraa.
translation: Then it goes into the hands of serene and great jewellers.

gurmukhi: mjls AMdir dyKdy pwiqswh vjIrw
transliteration: Majalas Andari Daykhaday Paatisaah Vajeeraa.
translation: In the gatherings the kings and the ministers test and check it.

gurmukhi: mulu krin Ajmwie kY swhw mn DIrw
transliteration: Mulu Karani Ajamaai Kai Saahaa Man Dheeraa.
translation: The bankers in full confidence evaluate it.

gurmukhi: Ahrix auqY riK kY Gx Gwau srIrw
transliteration: Aharani Outai Rakhi Kai Ghan Ghaau Sareeraa.
translation: Putting it on the anvil by the strokes of hammers its body is tried for wounds.

gurmukhi: ivrlw hI Tihrwvdw drgh gur pIrw ]16]
transliteration: Viralaa Hee Tdahiraavadaa Daragah Gur Peeraa ?16?
translation: Any rare one remains intact. Likewise any rare one reaches the court of the Guru (God) i.e. any rare one escapes the darkness of maya and its infatuations.

gurmukhi: 17 gurmuK cwl
translation: The way of Gurmukhs

gurmukhi: qir fubY fubw qrY pI iprm ipAwlw
transliteration: Tari Doubai Doubaa Tarai Pee Piram Piaalaa.
translation: One who quaffs the cup of love superficially drowns himself but in fact getting inebriated one who drowns in it swims it and gets across.

gurmukhi: ijix hwrY hwrY ijxY eyhu gurmuiK cwlw
transliteration: Jini Haarai Haarai Jinai Ayhu Guramoukhi Chaalaa.
translation: This is the way of the gurmukhs that they lose while winning and losing everything they win one and all.

gurmukhi: mwrgu KMfy Dwr hY Bvjlu Brnwlw
transliteration: Maaragu Khanday Dhaar Hai Bhavajalu Bharanaalaa.
translation: The way into the world ocean is like a double edged sword is like a killing stone

gurmukhi: vwlhu inkw AwKIAY gur pMQu inrwlw
transliteration: Vaalahu Nikaa Aakheeai Gur Pandu Niraalaa.
translation: Which perishes everything, and the ill-advised intellect is the abode of evil deeds.

gurmukhi: haumY bjru Bwr hY durmiq durwlw
transliteration: Haoumai Bajaru Bhaar Hai Duramati Duraalaa.
translation: The disciple of the Guru loses his ego through the Gurmat

gurmukhi: gurmiq Awpu gvwie kY isKu jwie suKwlw ]17]
transliteration: Guramati Aapu Gavaai Kai Sikhu Jaai Soukhaalaa ?17?
translation: , the wisdom of the Guru and goes across this world ocean.

gurmukhi: 18 bohV qoN aupdyS
translation: Like the expansion of banyan tree of the Sikhs of the Guru spread Nam

gurmukhi: Driq vVY viV bIau hoie jVH AMdir jMmY
transliteration: Dharati Varhai Varhi Beeu Hoi Jarh Andari Janmai.
translation: The seed enters the earth and settles in the form of root.

gurmukhi: hoie brUtw cuhcuhw mUl fwl DrMmY
transliteration: Hoi Barootaa Chuhachuhaa Mool Daal Dharanmai.
translation: Then in the form of verdant plant it becomes stem and branches.

gurmukhi: ibrK Akwr ibQwru kir bhu jtw plMmY
transliteration: Birakh Akaaru Bidaaru Kir Bahu Jataa Palamai.
translation: Becoming tree it extends further and tangled branches hang from it.

gurmukhi: jtw ltw imil Driq ivic hoie mUl AgMmY
transliteration: Jataa Lataa Mili Dharati Vichi Hoi Mool Aganmai.
translation: These flourishing branches ultimately entering the earth again attain the form of roots.

gurmukhi: CwNv GxI pq sohxy Pl l`K lKMmY
transliteration: Chhaanv Ghanee Pat Sohanay Phal Lakh Lakhanmai.
translation: Now its shade becomes think and leaves appear beautiful and millions of fruits grow on it.

gurmukhi: Pl Pl AMdir bIA bhu gurisK mrMmY ]18]
transliteration: Phal Phal Andari Beea Bahu Gur Sikh Maranmai ?18?
translation: In each fruit remain many seeds (and this process goes on). The mystery of the Sikhs of the Guru is the same; they also like banyan tree go on spreading the name of the Lord.

gurmukhi: 19 gur biR`C rUp
translation: Guru in the form of a tree

gurmukhi: ieku isKu duie swD sMgu pMjIN prmysru
transliteration: Iku Sikhu Dui Saadh Sangu Panjeen Paramaysaru.
translation: One is a Sikh, two the congregation and in five resides God.

gurmukhi: nau AMg nIl AnIl suMn Avqwr mhysru
transliteration: Nau Ang Neel Aneel Sounn Avataar Mahaysaru.
translation: As cyphers added to one make the infinite number, likewise getting attached with Sunya (God), the creatures also transform into great men and kings of the earth.

gurmukhi: vIh iekIh AsMK sMK mukqy mukqysru
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Asankh Sankh Moukatai Moukataysaru.
translation: In this way innumerable small and big persons also become liberated and liberators.

gurmukhi: ngir ngir mY shMs isK dys dys lKysru
transliteration: Nagari Nagari Mai Sahans Sikh Days Days Lakhaysaru.
translation: In town after town and country after country are myriads of Sikhs.

gurmukhi: iekdUM ibrKhu lK Pl Pl bIA lomysru
transliteration: Ikadoon Birakhahu Lakh Phal Phal Beea Lomaysaru.
translation: As millions of fruits are obtained from a tree and in those fruits remain millions of seeds (In fact the Sikhs are the fruits of the Guru-tree and in those fruits the Guru resides in the form of seeds).

gurmukhi: Bog Bugiq rwjysurw jog jugiq jogysru ]19]
transliteration: Bhog Bhougati Raajaysuraa Jog Jougati Jogaysaru ?19?
translation: These disciples of the Guru being enjoyers of delights are the emperors of the kings and being knower of the technique of yoga are kings of yogis.

gurmukhi: 20 nwmI Swh
translation: A wealthy banker

gurmukhi: pIr murIdw iprhVI vxjwry swhY
transliteration: Peer Mureedaa Piraharhee Vanajaaray Saahai.
translation: The love between the disciples and the Guru is the same as is there between a trader and a banker.

gurmukhi: saudw iekqu hit hY sMswr ivswhY
transliteration: Saudaa Ikatu Hati Hai Sansaaru Visaahai.
translation: The merchandise of the name of the Lord is available only at one ship (of the Guru) and the whole world purchases there-from only.

gurmukhi: koeI vycY kaufIAw ko dm augwhY
transliteration: Koee Vaychai Kaudeeaa Ko Dam Ougaahai.
translation: Some of the worldly shopkeepers are selling trash whereas others are collecting money.

gurmukhi: koeI rupXy ivkxY suneIey ko fwhY
transliteration: Koee Roupayay Vikanai Sounaeeay Ko Daahai.
translation: Some are storing the gold coins after spending rupees;

gurmukhi: koeI rqn vxMjdw kir isPiq slwhY
transliteration: Koee Ratan Vananjadaa Kari Sidhati Salaahai.
translation: And there are some that are dealing in jewels of the eulogisation of the Lord.

gurmukhi: vxij supqw swh nwil vyswhu inbwhY ]20]
transliteration: Vanaji Soupataa Saah Naali Vaysaahu Nibaahai ?20?
translation: Any rare honourable banker having full faith in the Lord maintains this trade.

gurmukhi: 21 siqgur Swh
translation: True Guru, the merchant

gurmukhi: saudw iekqu hit hY swhu siqguru pUrw
transliteration: Saudaa Ikatu Hati Hai Saahu Satiguru Pooraa.
translation: The perfect true Guru keeps the actual merchandise (of the name of the Lord).

gurmukhi: Aaugux lY gux ivkxY vcnY dw sUrw
transliteration: Aougoun Lai Goun Vikanai Vachanai Daa Sooraa.
translation: He is that brave person who accepts the evils and upkeep’s his reputation of being giver of virtues.

gurmukhi: sPlu krY isMmlu ibrKu sovrnu mnUrw
transliteration: Saphalu Karai Sinmalu Birakhu Sovaranu Manooraa.
translation: He can grow juicy fruits on silk-cotton trees and can produce gold from the iron ash.

gurmukhi: vwsu suvwsu invwsu kir kwau hMsu n aUrw
transliteration: Vaasi Suvaasu Nivaasu Kari Kaau Hansu N Ooraa.
translation: He infuses fragrance in the bamboo i.e. he makes egotists feel humble and makes crows no less than swans who are capable of distinguishing water from milk.

gurmukhi: GuGU suJ suJwiedw sMK moqI cUrw
transliteration: Ghoughoo Sujhu Sujhaaidaa Sankh Motee Chooraa.
translation: He transforms owls into knowledgeable ones and dust into conches and pearls.

gurmukhi: vyd kqybhu bwhrw gur sbdu hjUrw ]21]
transliteration: Vayd Kataybahu Baaharaa Gur Sabadi Hajooraa ?21?
translation: Such a Guru who is beyond the description of the Vedas and Katebas (the semitic scriptures becomes manifest by the grace of Word, the brahmn)

gurmukhi: 22 guropmw
translation: Praise of the Guru

gurmukhi: lK aupmw aupmw krY aupmw n vKwxY
transliteration: Lakh Oupamaa Oupamaa Karai Oupamaan Vakhaanai.
translation: People praise the Guru through millions of ways and to do so take help of many comparisons.

gurmukhi: lK mihmw mihmw krY mihmw hYrwxY
transliteration: Lakh Mahimaa Mahimaa Karai Mahimaa Hairaanai.
translation: Millions of people eulogise so much that even the eulogy feels wonder struck.

gurmukhi: lK mhwqm mhwqmw n mhwqm jwxY
transliteration: Lakh Mahaatam Mahaatamaa N Mahaatamu Jaanai.
translation: Millions of spiritualists explain the grandeur of Guru but they do not understand the same.

gurmukhi: lK ausqiq ausqiq krY ausqiq n is\\wxY
transliteration: Lakh Ousatati Ousatati Karai Ousatati N Siaanai.
translation: Millions of eulogisers recite praise s but they do not understand the real praise.

gurmukhi: Awid purKu Awdys hY mYN mwxu inmwxY ]22]
transliteration: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Hai Main Maanu Nimaanai ?22?
translation: I respectfully bow before such a primeval Lord who is the pride of the humble person like me.

gurmukhi: 23 qQwc gur pRqwp
translation: Praise of the Guru

gurmukhi: lK miq lK buiD suiD lK lK cqurweI
transliteration: Lakh Mati Lakh Budhi Sudhi Lakh Lakh Chaturaaee.
translation: Millions of sects, intellects, thoughts and skills may exist;

gurmukhi: lK lK aukiq isAwxpwN lK suriq smweI
transliteration: Lakh Lakh Oukati Siaanapaan Lakh Surati Samaaee.
translation: Millions of phrases, techniques and methods of absorption into the consciousness may exist;

gurmukhi: lK igAwn iDAwn lK lK ismrx rweI
transliteration: Lakh Giaan Dhiaan Lakh Lakh Simaran Raaee.
translation: Millions of knowledge’s, meditations and remembrance may be there;

gurmukhi: lK ividAw lK iest jp qMq mMq kmweI
transliteration: Lakh Vidiaa Lakh Isat Jap Tant Mant Kamaaee.
translation: Millions of education’s, recitations for the objectives and tantra-mantra praxis may exist;

gurmukhi: lK Bugiq lK lK Bgiq lK mukiq imlweI
transliteration: Lakh Bhougati Lakh Lakh Bhagati Lakh Moukati Milaaee.
translation: Millions of delights, devotions and liberation’s may be mixed up,

gurmukhi: ijau qwry idh augvY AwnHyr gvweI
transliteration: Jiu Taaray Dih Ougavai Aanhayr Gavaaee.
translation: But as the darkness and the stars elope when the sun rises, likewise by losing all the objects mentioned above and by becoming the dear friend of the Guru,

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu Agmu hY hoie iprm sKweI ]23]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Agamu Hai Hoi Piram Sakhaaee ?23?
translation: The gurmukh can attain the unapproachable pleasure-fruit of the Lord.

gurmukhi: 24 vwihgurU mihmw
translation: Praises of Waheguru, the wondrous Lord

gurmukhi: lK Acrj Acrj hoie Acrj hYrwxw
transliteration: Lakh Acharaj Acharaj Hoi Acharaj Hairaanaa.
translation: Beholding the wondrous Lord myriad’s of wonders become full of wonder.

gurmukhi: ivsmu hoie ivsmwd lK lK coj ivfwxw
transliteration: Visamu Hoi Visamaad Lakh Lakh Choj Vidaanaa.
translation: Seeing his wonderful deeds, the elation itself becomes elated.

gurmukhi: lK AdBuq prmdBuqM prmdBuq Bwxw
transliteration: Lakh Adabhout Paramadabhoutee Paramadabhout Bhaanaa.
translation: Realising his marvellous Order many uncanny arrangements feel themselves full of wonder.

gurmukhi: Aibgiq giq AgwD boD AprMpru bwxw
transliteration: Abigati Gati Agaadh Bodh Aparanparu Baanaa.
translation: His unmanifest position is unknowable and His form and guise is formless.

gurmukhi: AkQ kQw Ajpw jpxu nyiq nyiq vKwxw
transliteration: Akad Kadaa Ajapaa Japanu Nayti Nayti Vakhaanaa.
translation: His tale is ineffable; unrecited recitations are performed for Him but even He is described as neti neti(not this not that).

gurmukhi: Awid prKu Awdysu hY kudriq kurbwxw ]24]
transliteration: Aadi Purakh Aadaysu Hai Kudarati Kurabaanaa ?24?
translation: I salute that primal Lord and I am sacrifice unto His feats.

gurmukhi: 25 Cy gurU ismrx
translation: Remembering the six Gurus

gurmukhi: pwrbHmu pUrx bHmu gur nwnk dyau
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Gur Naanak Dayu.
translation: Guru Nanak is perfect and transcendental Brahm.

gurmukhi: gur AMgdu gur AMg qy sc sbd smyau
transliteration: Gur Angadu Gur Ang Tay Sach Sabad Samayu.
translation: Guru Angad attained merger in Word by being in the company of the Guru.

gurmukhi: Amrwpdu gur AMgdhu Aiq AlK AByau
transliteration: Amaraapud Gur Angadahu Ati Alakh Abhayu.
translation: After Guru Angad, the imperceptible and without duality, Guru Amas Das, the bestower of immortality has flourished.

gurmukhi: gur Amrhu gur rwmdwsu giq ACl ACyau
transliteration: Gur Amarahu Gur Raamadaasu Gati Achhal Achhayu.
translation: After Guru Amar Das, the forbearing and storehouse of infinite virtues, Guru Ram Das made manifest his existence.

gurmukhi: rwm dws Arjx gurU Aibcl ArKyau
transliteration: Raam Rasak Arajan Guroo Abichal Arakhayu.
translation: From Guru Ram Das, Guru Arjan Dev, who absorbed one in Ram-Nam, beyond all blemishes and immovable one, was born.

gurmukhi: hirgoivMd goivMd guru kwrx krxyau ]25]
transliteration: Hari Govindu Govindu Guru Kaaran Karanayu ?25?13?tayraan?
translation: Then came Guru Hargobind who is the cause of all the causes i.e. who is Gobind, the Lord himself.

gurmukhi: nwnw imstwn pwn bhu ibMjnwid sÍwd sIcq srb rs rsnw khweI hY
transliteration: Naanaa Misataan Paan Bahu Binjanaadi Svaada , Seechat Sarab Ras Rasanaa Kahaaee Hai ?
translation: Tongue that enjoys many forms of sweet and savoury foods, drinks and is relisher of all the tastes is called gustation. Eyes see good and bad, beautiful and ugly and is therefore known as vision power.

gurmukhi: diRsit drs Aru sbd suriq ilv igAwn iDAwn ismrn Aimq bfweI hY
transliteration: Drisati Daras Aru Sabad Surati Liva , Giaan Dhiaan Simaran Amit Badaaee Hai ?
translation: Ears for their ability to hear all sorts of sounds, melodies etc. are called hearing power. With the use of all these faculties, one obtains knowledge of various things, focuses one's mind in meaningful thoughts and earns worldly respect.

gurmukhi: skl suriq Asprs Aau rwg nwd buiD bl bcn ibbyk tyk pweI hY
transliteration: Sakal Surati Asaparas Au Raag Naada , Budhi Bal Bachan Bibayk Tayk Paaee Hai ?
translation: The skin brings awareness of things through touch. Enjoyment of music and songs, intellect, strength, speech and dependence on discrimination is the boon of the Lord.

gurmukhi: gurmiq siqnwm ismrq sPl huie bolq mDur Duin suMn suKdweI hY ]13]
transliteration: Gurmati Satinaam Simarat Sadhal Hui , Bolat Madhur Dhouni Sounn Soukhadaaee Hai ?13?
translation: But all these senses of knowledge are useful if a person obtains the boon of Guru's wisdom, dwells his mind in the name of the Immortal Lord and sings the sweet paeans of me Lord's name. Such tune and melody of His name is bestower of bliss and happiness.
